001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.regex;
007
008import java.util.regex.Pattern;
009
010import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
011
012public final class RegexUtil {
013
014  /**
015   * Parse the regular expression flags according to
016   * <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#flags">the
017   * specification</a> producing a bitmask suitable for use in
018   * {@link Pattern#compile(String, int)}.
019   *
020   * @param flags
021   *          the flags to process
022   * @return the bitmask
023   */
024  public static int parseFlags(@NonNull String flags) {
025    return flags.codePoints()
026        .map(i -> characterToFlag((char) i))
027        .reduce(0, (mask, flag) -> mask | flag);
028  }
029
030  private static int characterToFlag(char ch) {
031    int retval;
032    switch (ch) {
033    case 's':
034      retval = Pattern.DOTALL;
035      break;
036    case 'm':
037      retval = Pattern.MULTILINE;
038      break;
039    case 'i':
040      retval = Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE;
041      break;
042    case 'x':
043      retval = Pattern.COMMENTS;
044      break;
045    case 'q':
046      retval = Pattern.LITERAL;
047      break;
048    default:
049      throw new RegularExpressionMetapathException(RegularExpressionMetapathException.INVALID_FLAG,
050          String.format("Invalid flag '%s'.", ch));
051    }
052    return retval;
053  }
054
055  private RegexUtil() {
056    // disable construction
057  }
058}
